comment: I would definitely avoid. Very strict, did not learn anything even though I love typography. Constantly threatens students of failure. Expect to create 20-page reports per project. 5 in total.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She is very strict and comes off as unprofessional and rude. She yelled at a student and threatened this individual of failure. Ironically, she took a leave of absence after this incident. You put more work into your project reports than working on your actual project. I love typography, but I learned nothing from her. Would avoid!

She is very strict and comes off as unprofessional. She yelled at a student and threatened this individual of failure. Ironically, she took a leave of absence after this incident. She is very passionate, but I dont like her method of threatening students with failure. After all, this was only a Typography 1 class.

Took for Type1. Did not enjoy it at all. She reminds you if you don't know your type anatomy that you will fail this class which is not very professional. I love typography, but she made every project feel like a chore. She is passionate, but comes across as rude and condescending.

Professor Lord is not only an extremely skilled designer but she is also an incredible teacher. She holds students to a high standard and helps the students achieve that level of excellency. If you are a serious designer and you want to truly learn how to be your best, take this professor! The class is fairly easy and very enjoyable.

She's super nice, but very strict. She makes her expectations clear; she does NOT accept late work. If you can work on a deadline, then  you'll be fine. She's easy to talk to, willing to help, and also willing to learn from her students, which is a breath of fresh air.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I had Professor Lord for Type I and I found her to be fantastic! Yes she can be hurtful during critiques and wants to see effort in your projects, but it is for your own benefit. She helps prepare you for the concentration portfolio and for the real world. People that don't like this professor don't try in her class. Amazing, but tough. Take her!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Probably the most frustrating art teacher I've had. Refuses to help you and asks you to "google it" instead. Doesn't teach and spends all class showing us videos instead. I've gotten A's on all the projects so far, but it's no thanks to her. DO NOT take her unless absolutely necessary. These are the 3 most miserable hours of my day by far.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This is a tough professor who knows her stuff.  Students who give her low ratings are the ones who do not meet the expectations in class and so they vent. She gives great lectures, sets high standards and grades fairly. I will take her again.

If you are taking other art classes, I don't recommend taking her class AT ALL. Her course load is a lot and she expects you to prioritize her course over others. She can be very condescending when commenting on your work. She is also extremely picky about presentation. If your board display isn't perfect, you'll get major points knocked off.
